Namespaces

namespace  xint
 

All of the functions in the XInt library are within this namespace.


Functions

Modular math functions

A common reason to use a large-integer library is to implement public-key encryption, and the algorithms for such encryption often use modular math.



integer xint::mod (const integer &n, const integer &m)
 Get the remainder after dividing a number by another.
integer xint::mulmod (const integer &n, const integer &by, const integer &m)
 Get the modular product of two integers.
integer xint::sqrmod (const integer &n, const integer &m)
 Get the modular product of squaring an integer.
integer xint::powmod (const integer &n, const integer &e, const integer &m, bool noMontgomery)
 Get the result of ne % m, keeping the intermediate results (relatively) small.

Detailed Description

Contains the definitions for the basic modular math functions.

The xint::invmod function, which logically would be here, is actually in gcd.cpp to share the gcd_core function.
